conclusion: Apply the ideal gas law equation for comparing two states of the same amount of gas.
State A: Pressure 1.0 × 10⁵ Pa, Volume 6.0 × 10⁻³ m³, Temperature 27°C.
Convert temperature from Celsius to Kelvin: T_A = 300 K.
State B: Pressure 2.0 × 10⁵ Pa, Volume 6.0 × 10⁻³ m³.
Set up the equation using the given data: (p_A V_A) / T_A = (p_B V_B) / T_B.
Plug in the known values and simplify: 0.002 = 1.200 / T_B.
The temperature of the gas in state B is 600 K.
